snippet: Ministers indicated at the start of a two-day meeting that recent decisions had provided breathing room to find longer-term solutions to the debt crisis.
abstract: Split emerges between France and Germany over the urgency of supporting the ailing Spanish economy and the scope of banking regulation for euro nations; discord threatens to subdue a rare period of optimism in the region’s three-year debt crisis.
lead_paragraph: Ministers indicated at the start of a two-day meeting that recent decisions had provided breathing room to find longer-term solutions to the debt crisis.

headline.seo: France and Germany at Odds Over Aiding Spain’s Economy
headline.main: France and Germany at Odds Over Aiding Spain’s Economy
headline.print_headline: Spain’s Struggling Economy Tops Agenda at Meeting of European Finance Ministers
